subject: Travel
title: Machu Picchu: City in the Clouds
description: A fast breakdown of Machu Picchu: City in the Clouds for builders.

hook.text: An Inca city sat 8,000 feet above sea level for 400 years. The Spanish never found it.

buildup.text: Built around 1450, Machu Picchu was likely an estate for Inca emperor Pachacuti. Only 750 people lived there.

discovery.text: American explorer Hiram Bingham reached it in 1911, guided by a local farmer who knew about it all along.

twist.text: Bingham took thousands of artifacts to Yale. Peru fought for decades to get them back and finally succeeded in 2012.

climax.text: Machu Picchu now hosts 1.5 million visitors a year. Erosion from tourism threatens the very ruins people come to see.

punchline.text: The locals always knew. The 'discoverer' just told the world.

quiz.question: Who guided Hiram Bingham to Machu Picchu?
options: A local farmer who already knew about it
